conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway/isometric 3D model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, and interior volumes; ceiling/roof is removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall extrusion with thickness, correct 3D corners, strong sense of interior volume, angled/isometric view, and clean cutaway showing interiors.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall 3BHK layout reads correctly (living/dining central, kitchen/utility on right, bedrooms positioned similarly, balcony placement generally consistent). Minor proportional/layout deviations and simplification around passages/balconies; some openings not perfectly verifiable/consistent with 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and kitchen elements are present and placed in the expected rooms with reasonable scale/orientation. Bathroom fixtures are minimal/less clearly defined compared to other rooms.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with good lighting and clean materials; however, floor text labels are present (presentation/UI contamination), reducing presentation quality points.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout/proportion deviations compared to the 2D plan (notably around balcony/passage geometry and some room dimension proportions).
Some door/window opening positions and/or sizing are simplified and not fully traceable to the exact 2D plan placements.
Text labels are embedded on the 3D floor surfaces, reducing presentation cleanliness.

summary: A clearly valid cutaway 3D conversion with strong volumetric modeling and generally faithful layout, with minor proportional/opening mismatches and text-label contamination.
